⚡⚡“Sweetie, do you remember? ”The Alpha king kneels between my legs and gave me shivers with his wet warm tongue. The intense heat, I seem to have experienced a million times...
------------------------------
"Elyse, how can you be so selfish?" her mother, Mrs. Marinda, hissed, her voice tinged with frustration. "This engagement meeting is crucial for our family's future. You can't just ignore it!"

"I'm not being selfish, Mom," Elyse replied, her voice quivering. "I just... I’m just so tired of all these. I can't marry someone I don't love. And this isn’t the first engagement meeting that you have arranged. Aren’t you tired of setting me up with those alphas when we very well know they would reject me anyway?! They don’t want me as their mate!"

Her mother's face contorted with anger, and without warning, her hand came down hard on Elyse's cheek, leaving a red mark in its wake. The slap echoed in the room, reverberating through Elyse's soul.

"You will do as I say," her mother said coldly, her eyes blazing with fury. "Our family's reputation is on the line, and you're the only one who can fix it. You think I wanted this life for us? We used to have everything, but because of your sudden disappearance, everything changed. This engagement is a way to secure our future and regain some impression of our former status."

Tears welled up in Elyse's eyes as she touched her stinging cheek, her resolve wavering, but her heart remained steadfast.

"You know he will reject me too," Elyse said, her voice trembling but determined. "But for your sake, I will attend that stupid meeting even though I feel like I am being satirized like a criminal every time people around me witnessed me being embarrassed as every stupid guy you choose for me eventually rejects me after believing a stupid rumor!"

Mrs. Marinda's eyes narrowed, her hand trembling with suppressed emotion. "Just do what I say, you ungrateful woman! You have already caused enough damage to our family! Try to be useful at least before we all end up being the lowest of the low in this valley!”

Mrs. Marinda glared at her before leaving her alone. In the end, it wasn't just Elyse's cheek that bore the brunt of her mother's frustration.

But of course, Elyse didn’t have a choice but to follow. After all, she was so weak for her family.

After changing her clothes, she went to where the meeting was set.

She had hoped she didn’t.

“I’m sorry, Miss Elyse. I don’t think we will work out. Not to demean you but a woman like you doesn’t deserve to have our last name,” Ernest Marquee, the son of one of the most powerful families in Delinda Valley, stated with a smug look showing on his face.

Elyse’s stomach started churning and she felt like she wanted to vomit due to the overpowering emotion she was feeling right now.

Why? Why do I always have to be in this situation? Why do I have to deal with this? Why?

She wanted to speak out but she tried her best not to say anything nor even react openly in front of an arrogant man.

“That was so embarrassing. If that was me, I would cry this instant,”

“Did she really think that Ernest Marquee, the only son of the Marquee family and the next alpha of the Marquees Pack, would agree to be her mate? She was reaching,”

“Look at her face though. I must admit, she had gotten even more beautiful after three years. We all know how every guy at Delinda Valley was smitten with her,”

At this point, Ernest’s ego was already at the top. Why not? He just rejected the most beautiful woman not only in Delinda Valley but in all three valleys!

The guys would surely be amazed at me once I come back to the camp! Imagine how the most beautiful woman in town was begging to marry me and be my mate. If only my parents allowed me to marry her. I don’t really mind about those rumors. With her beauty, as long as she could satisfy me in bed, that’s all that matters. Ernest’s mind was running with so many thoughts at this point.

Of course, he knew Elyse. She’s the topic of all werewolves and humans in town. Not only does she possess an incomparable beauty and physique, but simply her smile could make anyone’s knees weak. She is a woman with a goddess-like beauty. Everything about her just looks ethereal.

Ever since then, men and even women wish to be noticed by her. Until she suddenly disappeared three years ago and no one knew where she had gone.

He raised his eyebrow when he didn’t hear any response from her. He was expecting her to react badly, to show so much embarrassment.

After all, being rejected in front of many people is always a subject of scrutiny and mockery in Delinda Valley. This was the reason why he chose for the meeting to be held at the café. He wanted to have the upper hand. Ernest was proud to be one of those who rejected the famous Elyse Marinda of Delinda Valley.

“I hope I didn’t make you feel so upset,” he tried to get a reaction from her to even boost his ego. “You understand me, right? C’mon! I am sure you were expecting to hear this from me too. Did you actually think I would agree to marry you? Of all the women in Delinda Valley, did you ever think someone of my class would choose a lowly woman like you?” he mocked her. Despite her beauty, Ernest knew that his social status was something that Elyse’s family needed.

Elyse’s hand balled into a fist and she tried her best to keep them hidden under the table. But hearing those words obviously affects her. It  hurt.

Why was she being scrutinized like she was someone with a curse? I didn’t want to marry you. I don’t even like you. She wanted to tell him that but again, stopped herself.

Ernest Marquee was right though. She was expecting him to reject her. After all, this wasn’t the first time she received a rejection.

How many rejections have I received already after I came back? Five? Six? I already lost count.

And each time, her confidence hits rock bottom. She used to be called the Delinda Valley’s beauty. And some think she still is. But the rumors surrounding her tainted her image.

Now, every man in Delinda Valley looks at her like she was someone they can play with and not someone they could consider as their mate. They want to have sex with her but not marry her.

Ernest Marquee leans on the chair, trying to look dominant, wanting her to feel small. But he wasn’t really like that in Elyse’s eyes.

Elyse was sure everyone at the café heard what he said, one proof is how she heard a few bursts of laughter from behind her.

She could feel her back burning from all the stares she was receiving. She didn’t have to turn around to know that everyone was watching them. And by the look that Ernest Marquee has on his face, it was easy to say that he was enjoying the attention he was receiving.

She could hear everything they were talking about.

“What a pity. She got rejected again. I feel so bad for her,”

“Her family should give up on finding her a mate. With all the rejections she had received, she’s as good as being just a side chick forever,”

“How many rejections has it been? Seven? Eight? I am surprised she still has the courage to even try to meet these wolves hoping she could finally find a mate,”

“I can’t blame her. Her family has been desperate. They said she has the most beautiful face in all three valleys’ and yet her family couldn’t stop the rumors that she got pregnant that’s why she left the valley three years ago,”

“Was it real though? They said she got into an accident and that she lost part of her memories,”

“You believe that? That was obviously a scam. I remember seeing her three years ago. Something in her changed. She had a baby, that’s for sure. They said she didn’t know who the father was that’s why her family hide her,”

“She’s not as innocent as she looks. Her beauty couldn’t hide the dirt that she has. At this point, everyone here at Delinda Valley is a much better option to be a mate than her,”

Elyse tried to control the emotion showing on her face and smiled though deep inside, she could feel her stomach churning from the embarrassment she was feeling.

Hearing everything makes her want to scream.

She just can’t understand how these people could freely talk about her as if she wasn’t there. The truth was, she didn’t really want to come here. She didn’t want to meet him especially not in a public place like this.

It’s okay, Elyse. Don’t let your emotion get the best of you.

Ernest slowly leans on the table, the admiration showing in his eyes didn’t get passed her as well. But if there’s one thing, Elyse wanted to wipe the smug look that was showing on his face.

“But we can date while I don’t have a mate yet. We can have fun! I know you’re not innocent as well. Everyone knows that you know how to play around with men,” he meaningfully whispered before slowly reaching for her hand.

Elyse quickly pulled her hand away, feeling chills from the unwanted contact.

“I don’t know what you are talking about Mr. Marquee. Please be mindful of your words. I understand that you are rejecting me but please do not talk to me like that” Elyse cleared her throat and sat properly.

Her cheeks were burning red and she could her emotion rising and rising. “I will inform my parents that you refuse to be mated with me and that’s fine. I know that your family is more powerful than ours but please, show me some respect,”

Why was it so bad for someone like me to ask for respect? I didn’t do anything wrong to them! She wanted to scream at everyone because of the embarrassment that she was receiving right now.

They were all talking about the rumors surrounding her but no one bother to even ask her if that was true.

Even the friends that she had before were all avoiding her. It’s like there was a rule circulating around Delinda Valley not to associate themselves with a dirty woman like her.

Ernest snickered before laughing a little. Elyse could feel the heavy stares behind her. She also heard the other girls snickering as if wanting to laugh at her words.

“Stop playing hard to get, Miss Marinda. I have heard the rumors about you, how you sneak at night and met up with your former mates. You seduce men with your beauty and play with them all night. I can do better in bed. I am sure I can give you what your body wants and who knows, perhaps we can still do things even after I get married,”

Hearing what he just felt like a bucket of cold water was splashed in her face. She was frozen, rigid in her place, unable to breathe. The ringing in her ears started to get stronger, something she had been constantly experiencing whenever she starts to get stressed. It all started after she regained consciousness and found herself in her room with no memories of the past three years of her life.

According to her family, she had gone missing and they thought she was already dead. But one day, they found her outside of the house. It’s been a few months since that but nothing had been right after.

Things in her life had shifted altogether and everything was a mess.

Elyse could hear the murmurs surrounding her and that’s all it took for her to stand up and abruptly take her bag from her chair.

“This is just too much. I’m leaving!”

She quickly rushed outside despite her knees shaking and her whole body trembling. She was trying her best to keep herself from crying.

I hate everyone. I hate my life!

Ernest’s eyes shifted. In a snap, he also stood up from his chair as he was in a rush to follow her.

“Where do you think you are going?!” he screamed but Elyse didn’t even spare him a glance.

As Elyse reached the door, it suddenly opened. Elyse’s vision was already blurry and it was already too late for her to avoid crashing into the other person who just came in.

And just like that, Ernest was also able to reach her arm and yanked her towards him with brutal force.

“I said where the  are you going?! How dare you ran away from me?! Do you think you have the right to offend me?!” he roared but Elyse’s ears were already ringing so loud that she couldn’t even decipher half the things he said.

“Let go of me!” She tried pulling her arm away from him and as she opened her eyes, she saw how Ernest’s eyes turned red, his hand about to hit her face. But before that happens, Elyse felt a hand wrapped around her waist, a powerful force pulling her away from Ernest Marquee.

She didn’t understand what was happening but she felt it, the sudden dip on her stomach and the weird feeling that she had from the burning touch that flickered on her skin.

In a second, Ernest Marquee was kneeling on the floor.

Everyone inside the café felt the powerful aura that suddenly enveloped the place. It was terrifying that even Elyse who has so little of werewolf blood in her felt the overpowering presence that was suffocating everyone.

In all three valleys, Ernest could be classified as one of the strongest alphas alive. Even though he is not still the current alpha head of his pack, his power was more than enough to make an ordinary werewolf fall on their knees.

Elyse turned her head and her eyes widened at the sight before her.

The moment she lifted her gaze, her heart almost jumped out of her chest at the sight of the beautiful man that was holding her waist. He wasn’t even looking at her but his side profile looks so perfect she even forgot to breathe.

His chiseled jaw and sharp nose were mesmerizing to her that even though she knows that everyone at the café was probably having a hard time due to the strong presence that he has, it was easy to assume that all the girls were also shocked by his visuals. He looks like a god who descended from above.

He is simply breathtaking…

2
Her heart skipped a beat when she looked at him. He was breathtakingly beautiful like a god descended from the heavens. The aura of strength surrounding him made even the powerful Ernest Marquee kneel before him.

At that moment, Elyse forgot about everyone else in the café. She couldn't tear her eyes away from this divine stranger. His chiseled jawline and sharp nose exuded an air of authority that captivated her entirely.

Though the powerful energy in the room overwhelmed everyone else, she felt inexplicably drawn to him. He looked like someone who could change her life, a chance for redemption she desperately needed.

And as this beautiful stranger stood between her and Ernest, his presence offered a glimmer of hope that she might not be destined for a life of misery and ridicule after all.

The stranger's grip on her waist remained firm yet gentle, a stark contrast to the forceful hold Ernest had on her moments ago. His eyes, a mesmerizing shade of deep blue, were intense but filled with concern as he glanced down at her.

"Are you alright?" he asked, his voice soothing, like a calming breeze in the midst of a storm.

Elyse felt a lump forming in her throat, and it took her a moment to find her voice. "Yes, I... I'm okay," she managed to stammer, feeling an odd mixture of fear and comfort in his presence.

The stranger then turned his attention to Ernest, who was still on his knees, clearly overwhelmed by the stranger's power. "I suggest you leave now," he said in a low, commanding tone.

Ernest, now looking more like a trembling puppy than the confident alpha he had been moments ago, quickly nodded and scurried away, humiliated and defeated.

The café fell into an uneasy silence as the stranger continued to exude an aura of strength and authority. All eyes were on him, and the hushed whispers of the onlookers spoke of both admiration and fear.

Elyse finally tore her gaze away from the stranger to glance around the café. She saw shocked expressions, confused looks, and a few lingering glares. Yet, amidst the judgmental gazes, she also noticed something else—a flicker of hope and intrigue in the eyes of some people.

The divine stranger turned his attention back to Elyse, his piercing blue eyes locking with hers. "I'm sorry you had to go through that," he said gently. "No one deserves to be treated that way."

Her heart skipped a beat, and she felt warmth spreading through her. For the first time in a long while, someone was genuinely empathizing with her, seeing her as more than just the subject of rumors and gossip. The stranger's words touched her soul, and she couldn't help but feel a connection forming between them.

"I... thank you," she murmured, her voice barely above a whisper.

He gave her a soft smile, and Elyse's breath caught in her throat.

"What’s your name?" Elyse can’t help but ask.

The man looked at her straight in the eyes, as if he was examining her, trying to figure out the things hidden in her very soul. His piercing blue eyes were a little too cold, and menacing but something about how he looked at her makes her less afraid.

The beautiful man sighs as if he had given up on something before he finally responded. “My name is Alexander,” he whispered as if waiting for Elyse to say something about his name.

"Elyse," she replied, still feeling a bit overwhelmed by the whole situation.

Alexander nodded. "That’s a nice necklace that you have," he meaningfully stated, gesturing to the necklace she wore.

Elyse looked at the necklace she was wearing and bit her lower lip. It was something that she was already wearing when she came back. It was a gold necklace with a pendant that has multiple colors, like a shade of Iridescent.

For some reason, she always keeps it to herself and never really removed it as it brings comfort to her.

She reached for her necklace and started massaging the stone like it would do something to ease her nerves.

Alexander's gaze softened as he studied her. "You've been through a lot, haven't you?" he asked gently.

A lump formed in her throat once more, and she nodded, unable to find the words to respond.

"I know it's not easy, but you're stronger than you think," Alexander said, his voice reassuring. "You don't have to face everything alone."

Her heart swelled at his kindness and the comfort he offered. Despite the chaos surrounding her life, Alexander's presence made her feel safe as if she had finally found someone who understood her pain.

But his aura was very strong and one proof is how everyone seemed to be afraid to go close to him, like the moment anyone walks close, they will die from his wrath. He’s like a cold devil lurking on his prey right now, except Elyse doesn’t feel that he is a threat to her.

"Why did you help me?" she couldn't help but ask. "You don't even know me."

"Is there a reason why I shouldn’t help you?” he raised his eyebrow and something on Elyse’s stomach churned.

Elyse noticed how everyone was looking in their direction.

“Who is he? I have never seen him in Delinda Valley before,”

“Maybe he’s formed the next valley. Why is he talking to the cursed woman though? He should stay away from her if he knew better,”

“But did you see what he did to Ernest? He is so strong, who is he?”

Alexander, finally realizing that the presence of the people around the café was bothering her, reached for her hand and lead them outside.

“Thank you,” she whispered and for some reason, the moment Alexander let go of her hand, there was a strange feeling of absence she felt because of it but simply disregard it as she was still overwhelmed with emotions.

“It’s nothing. No one deserves to be treated like that. So, don’t ever think that anyone has the right to treat you that way,”

Elyse blinked back tears, touched by his words. No one had ever seen her beyond the scandalous stories and the judgments.

Elyse's emotions were a whirlwind as she stood there with Alexander. She felt like she was at a crossroads, torn between escaping from the crowd and staying to learn more about this enigmatic stranger.

"Would you like to get some fresh air?" Alexander asked, sensing her inner conflict.

She nodded gratefully, and together they started walking. The moment she was fully away from the cafe, Elyse felt a sense of relief. The cool breeze brushed against her face, calming her nerves.

Alexander looked at her with concern. "I hope I didn't intrude or cause any more problems for you."

Elyse shook her head, a small smile forming. "You saved me from a situation I couldn't handle on my own. I can't thank you enough."

His eyes softened, and he reached out to gently touch her hand. "You don't need to thank me. It's just what any decent person would do."

Decency. That was something Elyse hadn't experienced much lately. But in Alexander's presence, she felt a glimmer of hope. Maybe, just maybe, things could change for her.

As they stood there together, Elyse realized that this chance encounter with Alexander might be the turning point in her life. And while the scars of her past remained, she felt a newfound strength building within her—a strength born from the kindness and understanding of a stranger named Alexander.

3
The next morning, Elyse woke up with a heavy heart. Her cheek still stung from the slap she received the previous day when her mother found out about her encounter with Ernest and the mysterious stranger. She dreaded facing her mother, knowing that another confrontation was inevitable.

As she made her way downstairs, she tried to hide the pain in her eyes, but her mother noticed immediately. Mrs. Marinda's face was a mix of concern and irritation.

"Elyse, I hope you've learned your lesson from yesterday," her mother said sternly, her voice tinged with annoyance. "That man who saved you, he's probably just one of your...boys, isn't he? Don't think you can fool me with your little tricks."

Elyse's heart sank at her mother's implication. She felt hurt and betrayed that her own mother would think so little of her. "Mom, you know that's not true," she replied, her voice trembling with emotion. "He's a complete stranger, and he was just being kind. Please, you have to trust me."

Mrs. Marinda's face contorted with frustration. "Trust you? Look at what you've brought upon this family with your reputation," she snapped. "The rumors, the gossip...maybe there's some truth to them after all."

Tears welled up in Elyse's eyes, and she fought to keep them from falling. She had always wanted her mother's approval and love, but it seemed like she could never live up to her expectations.

"I'm not what they say I am," Elyse said softly, trying to hold back her tears. "I want to find true love, someone who will see me for who I am, not just a name or a rumor. Can't you understand that?"

Her mother's expression softened for a moment, but the frustration quickly returned. "Enough of this nonsense," she said firmly. "We have an important gathering to attend tonight. The wealthiest families from all three valleys will be there, and it's the perfect opportunity for you to find a suitable mate."

Elyse's heart sank further. She knew her mother meant well, but she couldn't bear the thought of being forced into another loveless encounter.

"Mom, please," she pleaded, her voice filled with desperation. "I don't want to go through that again. Can't you see how much it hurts me?"

Her mother's eyes softened slightly, but she remained resolute. "This is for the best, Elyse," she said, her voice softening just a bit. "Our family's future depends on this. You need to make a good impression and find a mate who will secure our status."

Feeling defeated, Elyse nodded, her heart heavy with sadness. "Fine, I'll go," she said quietly. "But please, Mom, can you just trust me for once? I want to find love, not just a name to save our family's reputation."

Her mother sighed; the weight of their family's expectations was evident in her eyes. "I'll try," she said, her voice wavering slightly. "But you need to be careful, Elyse. Our family's future is at stake."

With a heavy heart, Elyse retreated to her room, trying to prepare herself for the gathering later that evening. She couldn't shake off the feeling of being trapped, torn between her own desires and the burden of her family's expectations.

As she looked at herself in the mirror, she saw a reflection of a woman longing for love and acceptance. She knew the road ahead wouldn't be easy, but she hoped that one day, she would find someone who would love her for who she truly was, scars and all.

As Elyse and her mother entered the grand gathering, the opulence of the venue overwhelmed her senses. The room was filled with the wealthiest families from all three valleys, and the air buzzed with excitement and anticipation.

As she walked through the crowd, Elyse couldn't help but notice the curious glances and admiring looks of some of the men. While she appreciated the compliments, the judgmental stares from certain women made her uncomfortable.

Her mother, Mrs. Marinda, guided her toward a group of families, hoping to find a suitable match for her daughter. Elyse's heart pounded with nervousness, knowing that the success of this evening would determine her family's future.

Suddenly, she spotted Ernest Marquee across the room, and her heart sank. The memory of their encounter at the café flooded back, along with the pain of his rejection. She quickly averted her gaze, not wanting to relive that humiliation.

As the night went on, Elyse tried her best to engage in polite conversation with the potential suitors her mother introduced her to. However, the rumors that had tarnished her reputation seemed to precede her, and she could sense the skepticism in their eyes.

Chantal, the woman who had confronted her earlier, was among the attendees, and she made sure to give Elyse disapproving glances whenever their paths crossed. Elyse's cheeks burned with embarrassment, feeling like she was being judged and ridiculed at every turn.

As the evening progressed, the atmosphere in the room grew tense, and Elyse felt the weight of expectations bearing down on her. She excused herself for a moment, needing a breather from the suffocating pressure.

In the quieter corner of the venue, she leaned against the wall, trying to regain her composure. But her solitude was short-lived as Chantal appeared, flanked by her group of gossiping friends.

"Well, well, well, look who's hiding in the shadows," Chantal taunted, a smirk playing on her lips. "Feeling overwhelmed, are we? I'm not surprised, given your track record with men."

Elyse's heart pounded in her chest as she felt the humiliation wash over her. She wanted to stand up for herself, but the words escaped her at the moment.

"You must have thick skin to keep showing your face after all those rejections," Chantal continued, her voice dripping with condescension. "I can't imagine what it feels like to be unwanted by every man you've encountered."

Tears welled up in Elyse's eyes, but she refused to let them fall. She took a deep breath, trying to find the strength to respond.

"You know nothing about me or my life," Elyse said, her voice steady but filled with hurt. "I won't let your cruel words define who I am. I am more than the rumors and the judgments."

Chantal laughed mockingly, unfazed by Elyse's attempt at defiance. "Oh, please. We all know the truth," she sneered, gesturing towards her friends. "No man here would want to be with a woman with such a tarnished reputation."

The weight of Chantal's words crushed Elyse's spirit, and she felt the familiar pang of loneliness.

Desperate to escape the situation, she excused herself away from that toxic crowd.

As she found a quiet corner to gather her thoughts, she suddenly noticed a young child, probably just a little not over three years old, standing a few feet away, his deep blue eyes fixed on her. He seemed to be alone and appeared to be a stranger amidst the crowd.

Curiosity and a sense of connection drew the boy closer to Elyse. He didn't say a word, but his gaze was gentle and comforting, like a beacon of understanding in the sea of judgment.

As the child approached, Elyse's heart softened, and without thinking, she extended her hand to him. Surprisingly, the boy took her hand in his, and a sense of warmth and safety washed over her.

They stood together in silence, the boy holding her hand tightly, his cold blue eyes locked onto hers. At that moment, Elyse felt a strange but powerful connection with this mysterious child.

"You seem to like holding hands," Elyse said softly, trying to break the silence. The boy didn't respond verbally but gave her a small nod, his gaze unwavering.

Elyse felt a sense of ease in the boy's presence as if he understood her struggles and offered silent support without judgment. It was a comfort she hadn't expected to find amidst the crowded gathering.

As they stood together, Elyse couldn't help but wonder who this boy was and what brought him to her side. His cold blue eyes held a sense of wisdom beyond his years, and she couldn't shake the feeling that there was something special about him.

She felt like she knew the child. But how?

"Don't come here, what do you want to do!" She wanted to escape, but was pressed tightly by him, almost unable to breathe...
--------------------------------------------------------------
Chapter 1 Longing, His Promise To Marry Her

In a disarranged room, a man and a woman were intertwined, their bodies tightly wrapped under sunlight.

When Duncan Mooney woke up, a woman with her delicate features hidden by her bangs lay in his muscular arms. Suddenly, she stirred while letting out a soft hum as she nuzzled closer to him.

It was then that Duncan suddenly noticed she was naked while feeling a throbbing headache. Her fair skin glowed under the sunlight and gleamed bright enough to make him squint his eyes. His trimmed eyebrows furrowed slightly as he scanned the room before memories of the events of the previous night came rushing back to him.

He was at the company's anniversary celebration and had indulged in more than a few drinks before retiring to the hotel and knocking out. In a daze, he felt a woman wrap her arms around his waist, and the skin contact ignited something in the air. And so, things that should and shouldn't have happened had happened. What he thought was a wild dream turned out to be a stark reality.

His pupils instantly darkened as he quickly got out of bed and rushed to get dressed. But then, his gaze froze. A blood stain as red as a rose on the crumpled bed sheets had caught his eyes. It's her first time!

For unknown reasons, he suddenly felt compelled to see the face of the woman whose innocence he had taken. However, he hesitated with his hands that were about to lift the tresses covering her delicate face merely an inch away. It's just a one-night stand. I don't need to dwell on it.

After all, women who sought his bed were always after money and power. And so, he picked up his suit from the bed and quickly left the room. Unbeknownst to him, a locket had slipped from the woman's neck as he picked up the suit. It accidentally got hooked onto the inside of his suit and left with him.

…

10 minutes later, an imposing Cullinan was swiftly navigated through the bustling streets while Duncan's secretary, Clark Walls, was earnestly reporting on work matters. But Duncan's aloof eyes were wandering as his thoughts drifted elsewhere.

It was because he vaguely recalled catching a whiff of a sweet fragrance the previous night and began to doubt if it was just his imagination. After all, he had lost his sense of smell since a car accident three years ago.

"Mr. Mooney, there's a holdout on Pine Street who refuses to move. Even the demolition team is stumped about it."

"Why?" Duncan snapped back to reality and asked curtly.

"The family operates a gambling den, and the owner is a compulsive gambler who's racked up a massive debt. They said the demolition compensation offer is too low and are demanding an outrageous amount. But if we don't demolish that land soon, it'll impact the upcoming tender."

In the car's back seat, the distinguished Duncan narrowed his dark eyes and commanded decisively, "Turn around and head to Pine Street."

Clark looked surprised but quickly caught on to Duncan's intent. It seems like Mr. Mooney wants to take action himself.

Soon, the driver made a turn and headed toward Pine Street. At the same time, a brief and distinct vibration emanated from the suit draped over Duncan's arm. So he fished for his phone in the pocket with his slender fingers when a pendant fell onto the floor mat. It was a golden cloud-shaped locket with the words "health and joy" engraved inside.

He bent down to retrieve it with his deep eyes fixated on the glinting locket as his pupils dilated with emotion. Is this locket from the woman earlier? Is it her? Is the person I searched for so long the woman I had a one-night stand with?

Clark glanced at Duncan with a puzzled expression. "Mr. Mooney, what's this?"

Duncan held the locket as though it was a precious treasure with a small smile on his lips. "Find someone for me."

"Who?"

"A woman."

Clark's eyes grew bigger. "A w-woman?"

What's happening? Mr. Mooney wants to find a woman. This is shocking. His surprise was understandable considering Duncan's vaunted image in Ascot.

Typically, the next in line to take over a family business was usually the appointed heir and also the legitimate son of the family. However, Duncan defied this custom as an illegitimate child. He used less than three years to turn Mooney Group, a dominant financial conglomerate, into a top multinational business. He had diversified the company's interests so that it was renowned not only for its real estate endeavor but also for its long-standing perfume company that mesmerized women with its exclusive fragrance. However, he remained single at the age of 28 and had never had a partner all these years despite his outstanding achievements. Rumors even suggested that he... didn't have a liking for women.

After a moment of shock, Clark asked again, "Mr. Mooney… can I have a range?"

"Shangri-La Hotel. Room 1205. Between 11 p.m. last night and 10 a.m. this morning."

Shangri-La Hotel? Did Mr. Mooney... spend the night with a woman? Clark forced himself to stay calm. His chubby arms shook as he reached for his phone to contact Shangri-La Hotel's hotel manager.

Meanwhile, Duncan leaned back lazily in the cushioned seat with the locket gleaming on his palms in the sunlight. His sharp gaze then softened, replaced by an infinite tenderness as he couldn't help but recall the little girl who had saved him with a piece of dinner roll in a blizzard 15 years ago.

At that time, he was 13 years old and still the illegitimate child of the Mooney Group. He couldn't let himself be known and was cast aside by his family. They had also banished him and his mother to a faraway and poverty-stricken countryside causing him and his mother to be at their lowest point in life. If it wasn't for the compassionate little girl who had helped them, they would have died from hunger.

After so many years, he was now the king of the city and wielded great power, yet that little girl was the only one he longed for.

He had thought of her numerous times and recalled her young voice as she said, "Hey, will you marry me when you grow up? This is my locket. Remember how it looks so you can find me when you grow up!"

He was determined to find her. He had promised her in his youth and intended to keep that promise no matter what!

Chapter 2 The Arrival of the Handsome Hero

One hour later, the bus swayed to a halt at Pine Street's intersection. Gabriella Burns got off the bus while feeling sore all over to be greeted by a place filled with wreckage and debris. Demolition warning signs were plastered everywhere too.

She then made her way through an alley until she stood in front of a well-preserved yet conspicuously isolated 'holdout' building amidst the ruins. It was her home and also a gambling den at the same time. Once a lively place, it now exuded an air of desolation due to the impending demolition and mounting gambling debts. Gabriella felt no particular sentimentality about her family's decline because she had more pressing matters to attend to. 

Taking a deep breath, Gabriella entered the living room with hickeys adorning her body. "Mom, Dad, I followed your instructions and spent the night with Mr. Mason. Could you please spare Grandma's life and help her," she pleaded. The middle-aged couple before her were her biological parents, but she harbored no feelings for them except hatred. 

Gabriella and her twin sister, Gina Burns, were born 22 years ago. Although she was born just four minutes after Gina, a self-appointed fortune teller had claimed that these four minutes supposedly caused her birth chart to clash with the rest of the family. As a result, her parents abandoned her at her grandmother, Matilda Reilly's, house in the countryside within a day of her birth, even denying her a birth certificate. Despite the lack of love from her parents toward her, Gabriella had no choice but to return and seek help from her parents with Matilda critically ill at that moment.

Upon hearing Gabriella's plea, her mother, Holly Eaton, who was sipping tea, stood up abruptly and flung the tea onto her face while reprimanding her angrily, "Gabriella, how dare you! I told you to accompany Mr. Mason, not some random man! We're dead meat because of you! How are we going to repay the 100 million gambling debt? You shameless b*tch!"

As Holly shouted, she slapped Gabriella once more furiously. Gabriella was stunned by the sudden slap and held her swollen cheek in disbelief. What does she mean? So I wasn't with Mr. Mason last night? Then who was that guy?

"Mom, Dad, come out! Mr. Mason is here! Mr. Mason, please let me go. This has nothing to do with me! It was all Gabriella's idea! You should take it out on her, please."

Amid Gabriella's confusion, Gina's voice hollered from the hall which startled her. Then, she turned around to see a paunchy old man, Josh Mason, in the front hall dragging Gina with a scowl on his face.

She frowned. So this is the real Mr. Mason?

Gabriella was horrified when she felt a sudden push from behind which caused her to stumble and stop in front of Josh.

Her father, Arthur Burns, then quickly intervened, "Mr. Mason, please calm down. She's the woman who was meant to accompany you last night, not Gina!"

Josh's eyes turned lecherous as he regarded the nearly identical sisters. "I don't care! I waited all night and got nothing! Your family owes me 100 million. If you can't pay up, I'll take both your daughters!" he roared and reached for Gabriella.

"Gabriella and Gina look the same, Mr. Mason. You don't really need both of them. We'll give you Gabriella. Please let Gina go! She's our beloved daughter! Please spare her!" Holly was so desperate that she almost begged Josh on her knees.

Shocked and appalled, Gabriella felt like a pawn in a cruel game. Gina's their daughter, but I'm not?

The two people standing before Gabriella were her parents, yet they were willing to sell her to settle debts. How can they say that? Blood is thicker than water means nothing to them! All they care about is their other daughter, Gina!

Gabriella was nauseated by the sleazy and repulsive plump Josh standing in front of her. She didn't want to be sold off like merchandise to such a person.

At that moment, she only had herself to rely on. And so, she wiped away her tears, summoned the courage, and broke free from Josh's grasp to run away.

"Gabriella, come back here! Don't think I'll clean up after you! You b*tch!" Gina yelled and ran after Gabriella's retreating figure as she was afraid that she would be forced to accompany Josh once Gabriella left.

…

On the other side, the luxurious Cullinan had slowly entered the intersection of Pine Street when Clark swiftly opened a screenshot and handed it to Duncan. "Mr. Mooney, the hotel just sent this surveillance screenshot. She's probably the woman you're looking for."

Duncan glanced at the screen. The girl in the screenshot had a cute baby face while her big eyes had a hint of panic in them. Her hair only reached her collarbone which showed off her graceful swan-like neck.

Although 15 years had gone by, this woman looked just like an older version of the girl in his childhood memories. She was exactly as he remembered.

"Mr. Mooney, should I initiate a city-wide search for her?" Clark asked as they pulled up to a rundown alley filled with debris and halted in front of the soon-to-be-demolished gambling den.

Suddenly, a petite woman emerged from the entrance and captured Duncan's intense gaze. His dark eyes instantly reflected a mixture of happiness and astonishment.

"Mr. Mooney?"

"No need for that."

"What?"

"I've found her." He then opened the door and got out of the car as he strode toward the woman.

Chapter 3 The Unexpected Marriage Proposal

Gabriella had already gone missing when Gina ran out. After looking around, Gina noticed a good-looking and regal man walking in her direction. He was dressed in a black-and-white striped suit. His handsome face was devoid of expression, and his cold eyes exuded a sense of wilfulness. She was instantly infatuated with him at first sight and was frozen to the spot for some time.

However, Josh, who followed closely behind, grabbed her wrist and pulled her into his arms. "Don't think you can run, Gina! You promised to accompany me last night. Do you really have 100 million to pay me back?"

Gina struggled and said, "Mr. Mason, I told you. It wasn't my doing. You should go find Ga..."

"Bah! She ran away. Do you think you can get away with this too? We agreed from the beginning that it was you who would accompany me! Tell me. Where were you last night?"

It was indeed Gina who was supposed to accompany Josh. However, Holly and Arthur couldn't bear to see her suffer. So they came up with a plan to switch the twins. Since Gabriella and Gina looked identical, they decided to push Gabriella out as she wasn't the favored child. But things didn't go as planned as Gabriella entered the wrong hotel room.

"Mr. Mason, let go of me!" Gina struggled desperately and was nauseous at the sight of his sleazy face!

However, not only did Josh refuse to let go of her but he also leaned down to peck her on the cheek.

Her struggle was in vain, and she could only scream for help, "Mr. Mason, don't touch me! Let's talk it out! Mom, Dad, save me!"

Bang! Out of the blue, Josh got struck by a hard punch on his head and collapsed to the ground.

Gina was stunned and looked up at the handsome man in front of her and swallowed dryly. Oh my god! He's gorgeous! And feral! How is there such a brilliant man in this world?

She almost couldn't stand upright, and Clark quickly stepped forward to support her. "Miss, are you alright?"

She mechanically shook her head. "I-I'm fine."

Clark then glanced at Duncan before asking, "Miss, were you at the Shangri-La Hotel's Room 1205 last night?"

Last night? Gina went to the Shangri-La Hotel last night. Could it be… that she slept with this marvelous man?!

But before she could answer, Josh swore and yelled from the ground, "You! Gina! I now know why you didn't come last night. So you've gotten your hands on a bigger fish!"

A dark look flashed across Duncan's eyes. She must be the woman from last night. But what's her relationship with him? Why must she accompany him?

Duncan then gestured to Clark with a meaningful look. And so, Clark stepped forward, raised his foot, and callously stomped on Josh's face while grinding it brutally against the ground. "Shut up! How dare you act out before Mr. Mooney?"

Mr. Mooney? Who else in Ascot refers to themselves as "Mr. Mooney" except for the all-powerful Duncan Mooney? So the man in front of me is… This realization shocked and filled Gina with jealousy. That despicable Gabriella! How did she manage to get into Duncan's bed?

Seeing Gina's shocked expression, Duncan calmly took out the locket from his pocket and asked her with lowered eyes. "Is this necklace yours?"

She instantly knew that it was Gabriella's necklace but didn't know whether she should admit it. After all, Gabriella had inexplicably become involved with Duncan. As a person of distinguished status, he would be most cautious of any woman who plotted against him. He must be fuming now, isn't he?

She was worried his anger would be directed toward her if she admitted it. Gina was torn, but Holly quickly caught on and snatched the locket while exclaiming, "Sir, this indeed belongs to Gina. She has been wearing it for 22 years! I was wondering where she had lost it. Turns out it's with you."

Then, Duncan looked at Gina and asked, "Do you remember who I am?"

But Gina was stunned. "Aren't you… Mr. Mooney, Duncan Mooney?"

"I'm not talking about that." Duncan's brows furrowed slightly. "You gave me a dinner roll 15 years ago and saved me. Don't you remember?"

"Huh?" Gina stared straight at his face. She couldn't have remembered it since it was Gabriella's doing.

"Sir!" Seeing this, Holly rushed to step up. "You see. Gina had a high fever when she was young and has forgotten many things."

She's forgotten everything? Duncan's deep pupils stared at her intensely as his handsome brows slightly furrowed.

That's fine. She forgot about me, but I still remember her. And that's enough. Duncan thought and took a step closer to Gina. His broad shadow loomed over her, and his handsome face was just inches above her head.

Her eyes widened instantly, and her starry-eyed look reappeared. He pondered for a second before slightly lowering his head and sniffing her. Unexpectedly, he couldn't smell the faint fragrance from the previous night on her. So he concluded that he was too drunk and probably imagined it. He believed he couldn't have smelled it since he had lost his sense of smell for many years. After a long silence, Duncan suddenly spoke, "Grab your birth certificate and come with me."

Gina was confused once again. "Grab my birth certificate?"

However, Clark immediately nudged Gina toward Duncan. "Miss, Mr. Mooney wants to marry you. Quick. Grab your birth certificate. You're getting married today!"

…

At the Ascot Hospital, Gabriella came out of the doctor's office after learning that Matilda's condition had worsened again, but she had no money to her name.

She had just completed her university studies with a major in perfume development. Although her grades were top-notch, she couldn't obtain her graduation certificate because she didn't have a birth certificate. This meant she didn't couldn't even get an interview for a job.

With no other choice left, she decided to anonymously send perfumes she designed to major perfume design companies including the world-renowned fragrance company—Eternal Scents. She hoped to get a chance to prove herself.

But Gabriella knew that a prestigious company like Eternal Scents would never hire her out of the blue. She also had a feeling that the samples she sent to a recent perfumery competition would only end up in the trash.

She sighed and subconsciously took out her phone, hoping to see if any company had called her for an interview. Unfortunately, not a single call came.

She slumped onto the cold bench in the hospital hallway. Without money and a job, her eyes glazed over from despair and misery. I don't understand why Mom and Dad treat me like this. Is it just because my birth chart clashes with theirs? But even so, they shouldn't neglect Grandma!

Gabriella was even willing to sleep with a stranger to save Matilda. But she ended up sleeping with the wrong person which made matters worse.

Recalling everything that happened last night, she felt wild and absurd. The man seemed to be drugged as he shamelessly demanded more from her repeatedly. But the room was too dark and she couldn't see his face at all.

She then shook her head, unwilling to recall such a humiliating incident for the second time. What was pressing for her was to quickly find a way to raise enough money for Matilda's treatment.

At that moment, she received a text message from an unknown number, 'I can save your grandmother.'

Gabriella was stunned at first. She didn't even consider the possibility that it could be a scam due to her desperate desire to save Matilda as she called back out of instinct and asked, "Who are you?"

The voice on the other end sounded like a robot. It was clearly filtered by a voice changer to mask the gender of the speaker. "It doesn't matter who I am. What matters is that I can save your grandmother's life."

"There's no such thing as a free lunch. You wouldn't help me for no reason."

The other person chuckled, "You're clever. I do have something to ask of you."

"What is it?"

"I want you to marry someone."

Gabriella hesitated and asked, "Who?"

"Duncan Mooney."

characters.description: A young woman with a troubled past, Gabriella is forced to marry Duncan Mooney, a wealthy and handsome man who claims to have known her since childhood.

characters.name: Duncan Mooney
characters.description: A wealthy and handsome man, Duncan Mooney claims to have known Gabriella since childhood and proposes to her in order to save her grandmother's life.
